name: The Juice of a Carrot.
description:
"The juice of the carrot, the smile of a parrot
A little drop of claret - anything that rocks"

This bright, punchy image forms part of the Reasons project. The aim was to use the imagery present in Ian Dury's lyrics to Reasons To Be Cheerful Part 3 and turn them into pop-art inspired still life images. These would then be used for a hypothetical re-release of the single.

I'm proud to offer a selection of these images for sale as glossy prints, either unmounted or mounted on 5mm foam board. 
At 12" x 12" they're the perfect size for framing and they look really rather superb.

name: Yellow Socks.
description:
"A bit of grin and bear it, a bit of come and share it
You're welcome, we can spare it, yellow socks"

This bright, punchy image forms part of the Reasons project. The aim was to use the imagery present in Ian Dury's lyrics to Reasons To Be Cheerful Part 3 and turn them into pop-art inspired still life images. These would then be used for a hypothetical re-release of the single.

name: BlueShift Zero.
description:
BlueShift is the first image in a brand new series. The twisting, glowing ribbon is a visualization of the possibility of the future.

I'm proud to offer this atmospheric, otherworldly image in a choice of either a rich glossy print or an amazingly cool metallic print with colours that really pop.

The print is 16" x 24" (15.5" x 23.5" image area) and comes packaged in a sturdy postal tube.

name: Reasons Poster.
description:
Glossy, 16" x 24" poster featuring all nine of the images from my Reasons To Be Cheerful project, along with the lyrics to this celebrated slice of funk. 

Posters can be signed or left as is. 

Delivery by Royal Mail First Class in a sturdy postal tube.
